definition: lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
to ask
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
ashamed

sentences.english: A clear conscience is a soft pillow.
But I don't have anything like this serenity when I'm writing an essay.
sentences.chinese: 但我寫文章時卻一點也沒法問心無愧。

sentences.english: Now Amy can serve this favorite with a clear conscience.
sentences.chinese: 現在埃米可以問心無愧地提供這種美味了。

sentences.english: Honestly, you go where sufficient affordable are carried head.
sentences.chinese: 問心無愧，已足夠你走到哪裏都擡得起頭。

sentences.english: In resigning, Mr. Yates said, 'I have acted with complete integrity and my conscience is clear, ' he said
sentences.chinese: 耶茨在辭職時說，我行事誠實正直，問心無愧。

sentences.english: We advocate commercial reputation and morality as to fulfill the desire FOR unashamed pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 本店崇尚商譽商德，以期得到問心無愧的滿足。

sentences.english: A clear conscience is usually a sign of a bad memory.
sentences.chinese: 問心無愧，一般是記性差的表現。

sentences.english: We are trying, treasure, a clear conscience.
sentences.chinese: 我們努力了，珍惜了，問心無愧。

sentences.english: A clear conscience laughs at false accusation.
sentences.chinese: 只要問心無愧，無端指責可一笑置之。

sentences.english: A clear  conscience is usually the sign of a bad memory.
sentences.chinese: 問心無愧也許是壞記性的表現。

definition: to try one's utmost/to strive
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to bear grudges
no complaints/to have no regrets
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to advise
genuine and sincere (idiom)/wholehearted
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to force someone to do something
